intro: Pouzolzia shirensis, commonly known as the Shirensis pouzolzia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Phyllanthaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland or woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It is often found in areas with moderate to high rainfall, and its growth is influenced by seasonal variations. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a species of interest for botanical research and conservation efforts.
